name: Vectornator Drawing
summary: Learn about .VECTORNATOR files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Graphic designers primarily use Linearity Vectornator to design icons, logos, GUI mockups, print designs, digital typography, and other vector illustrations. When a user saves a drawing in Vectornator, the application creates a VECTORNATOR file to store the illustration.
NOTE: Vectornator is now known as Curve, which saves users' drawings as .CURVE files. While VECTORNATOR files and CURVE files use different file extensions, they use the same file format.

instructions: You can open and edit VECTORNATOR files with Linearity Curve (formerly Vectornator) on a Mac, iPad, or iPhone. To open a VECTORNATOR file on a Mac, select File → Open... from Curve's menu bar.

While a VECTORNATOR file appears as a single file when saved, it is actually a macOS package that stores multiple files that contain information about the drawing. Examples of files typically found in a VECTORNATOR package include .JSON and .DAT data files and a PNG thumbnail image. To view the contents of a VECTORNATOR file in macOS, right-click the VECTORNATOR file and select Show Package Contents.
You can use Linearity Curve (formerly Vectornator) to convert a VECTORNATOR file to the following formats:
To do so, open your VECTORNATOR file in Curve, and then select File → Export....

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
